fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61128].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence search from JIRA Issue, which uses deprecated _confluence2.search_ of _xml-rpc_, does not work with some double-byte characters. REST API should be used instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.9.11 and JIRA Core 7.1.7 (latest), and applink them
# On Confluence, enable Remote API
# On Confluence, change indexing language to "CJK"
# On Confluence, create a space and create these 2 pages:
-- Title: Title-1 Body: ボディ (FYI, it is 'body' in Japanese)
-- Title: Title-2 Body: ボディ (FYI, it is 'body' in Japanese)
# On JIRA, create a project and a issue
# On JIRA's Issue detail view, go to "More" -> "Link" -> "Confluence Page" -> "search for a page", and search Confluence pages by keyword "ボディ"
# No search results, although you get the results if you use the same search keyword on Confluence (i.e. <CONF_BASE_URL>/dosearchsite.action?queryString=ボディ)

See also attached "theProblem.jpg"

h3. Expected Results
It should show the 2 pages created in the above step

h3. Actual Results
No search results.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2015-07-29 17:06:44,519 ERROR [http-nio-15806-exec-8] [confluence.rpc.auth.TokenAuthenticationInvocationHandler] invokeAuthenticatedMethod Error during invocation of method [search]
 -- url: /confluence15806/rpc/xmlrpc | userName: admin | method: search
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1955)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.search.summary.Summarizer.getSummary(Summarizer.java:164)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.GeneralUtil.makeSummary(GeneralUtil.java:1733)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.GeneralUtil.makeFlatSummary(GeneralUtil.java:1769)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteSearchResult.<init>(RemoteSearchResult.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.services.PagesSoapService.search(PagesSoapService.java:431)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.XhtmlSoapService.search(XhtmlSoapService.java:535)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor848.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:16)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1329.search(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.xmlrpc.ConfluenceXmlRpcHandlerImpl.search(ConfluenceXmlRpcHandlerImpl.java:485)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor847.invoke(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
I raised it as a bug instead of suggestion, because I firstly created a bug ticket for Confluence (CONF-38631), however, it was closed because JIRA uses _xml-rpc_, which was deprecated since Confluence 5.5.

h3.Workaround
No workaround is found so far
fields.summary: JIRA should use REST API to search Confluence pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61127].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
Subscriptions work off of the server time, instead of my local user time. If these two timezones are different, the user must manually calculate the right times for the system to use. 
Additionally, time ranges cannot be specified "backwards" - I cannot specify hourly notifications from starting at 10pm and finishing at 7am. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.1.2

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a filter
# Select Issues in the header, then Manage Filters
# Click 'Subscribe'

h3. Expected Results
Dialog uses local user time

h3. Actual Results
Dialog indicates that it uses server time

h3. Notes
The text indicating the server time is not very obvious, so this discrepancy may not even be noticed by users. 

h3. Workaround
Users can manually convert the times required. 
Users can add multiple subscription filters (say, 10pm - 11pm, and a second filter 12am - 7am).
fields.summary: Subscriptions use server time instead of local time
Ability to edit consumer callback URL in Application Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61122].
  {panel}

h5. PROBLEM:
In some cases, not all project admins should be able to create a user in JIRA. But unfortunately, with the current configuration, "create user" permission is bundled together with JIRA Administrator global permission which allows user who can manage a project to be able to create users in JIRA as well. 

h5. SUGGESTION:
It would be awesome if JIRA will have a standalone "Create User" permissions, separating it from JIRA Administrators global permission. In this way, we will have more flexibility when it comes to delegating permissions to each admins.
fields.summary: Separate "Create User" permission under Global Permissions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

I use 'mvn -version' to describe my env in the "Environment" field of a new JIRA for all Apache project, for example: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COLLECTIONS-589

It looks like this:

Apache Maven 3.3.9 (bb52d8502b132ec0a5a3f4c09453c07478323dc5; 2015-11-10T08:41:47-08:00)
Maven home: E:\Java\apache-maven-3.3.9\bin\..
Java version: 1.7.0_79, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_79\jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: Cp1252
OS name: "windows 7", version: "6.1", arch: "amd64", family: "windows"

It would be nice if tickets had fields for each component in the above.

Maybe when I admin/create a new JIRA project, I can pick whether to include "Maven version fields" which will be auto filled when I paste the above in the Environment text box.

2c,
Gary
fields.summary: Parse the output of 'mvn -version' and auto-fill in various fields.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

*Problem*
JIRA currently uses the base url to retrieve gadgets which has recently been causing alot of broken gadgets due to this issue :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget

*Suggestion*
* Allow JIRA to communicate to itself using a localhost
* Allow JIRA to call the gadgets using a 2nd base URL which can be configured to be localhost
* Allow JIRA to be configuted with Multiple Baseurl

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61111].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to mention customers.

In a normal setting, the 'mentions' functions allows JIRA users to mention and pull an issue to the attention of another user not involved in the ticket. However, in the case of Agents, this functionality is useful where they have thousands of users all over the globe, it would not be easy or efficient to copy exact spelling of the customers names.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the agents to mention customers to bring easy and efficiency to agents dealing with customers without worrying about the exact spelling. This mentions, unlike in JIRA, will not send an email notification, but would rather just assist the agent in working more efficiently.
fields.summary: As an Agent, I want to be able to 'mention' users rather than having to copy down the exact spelling of the name
Work Log on view issue screen is showing wrong time stamp

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61103].
  {panel}

Confusing our developers: The time tracking widget when viewing an issue shows a bar graph for Estimated time being *4 hours* and the remaining being 2 hours, but the time tracking view in the issue details view to the right of the backlog shows *2 hours* estimated and 2 hours for remaining. At the very least, this should be consistent. 

The parameters that lead to this are:
# Sub tasks with time listed for estimate and remaining.
# Include sub-tasks box checked in time-tracking widget the main issue viewing page. 
# Task times set <manually to sum of all sub-tasks> for estimated and 0 for remaining. 

The inconsistency is a bug and should be resolved. However, there is a much bigger usability problem here between sub-tasks and time tracking that should be resolved. See your own support forum for example: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/28328/jira-and-sub-tasks
and https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/84349/rapid-board-time-estimates-with-sub-tasks

The sub-tasks (when include sub-task time is checked) should be included in BOTH the estimate and the remaining. This has been an ongoing issue for many users at EVERY company I have worked for that uses JIRA. For, what should really not be a complicated fix, why is there not at least an option for this?
fields.summary: Time tracking for sub-tasks is inconsistent between views. As well as not intuitive.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61102].
  {panel}

User has created a dashboard that they share with other users. When they view the dashboard from their users, since they do not own the dashboard, the ability to edit the dashboard is disabled. This includes changing colors, edit, delete and dragging the dashboards to a new location.

They would like the ability to lock a dashboard from editing until they choose to unlock it so that their daily use of the dashboard is the same as the users that I share it with.
Periodically when minimizing a dashboard, it ends up dragging it instead of minimizing or maximizing. This is not a problem that other users have, because of permissions settings.
It was suggested giving control of the dashboard to another user, but then editing requires logging out and logging back in as a separate user in order to manage the dashboards.
The request is to add an option in the Tools menu to "Lock Dashboard" and then while it is locked have the "Un-Lock Dashboard" action. The Lock action causes the dashboard to draw as though the user was not the owner and restricts all edit permissions. And then when the Un-Lock action is performed, the dashboard reverts to the current behavior.
fields.summary: Enable ability to lock edit of dashboards from owner.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61063].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
On JIRA versions prior to 7, users are able to select multiple groups using the "ctrl' key and add the user on the selected groups, however on JIRA 7, JIRA administrators need type the name of the group, and search for it and then select it at a single time. 
It means that It will be necessary type each single group name when trying to add multiple memberships to a single user. This is a road blocker when there are a huge number of groups to be added.

h5. Suggestion
Allow existing groups to be selected on a similar way of JIRA 6.x versions. See attached screenshots for reference.
fields.summary: Allow to bulk add an user in multiple JIRA groups at once

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61062].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The formatting for text that begins or ends with white space does not work but instead simply displays the formatting characters. 
For Example: + JIRA +. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to enable or disable white space editing in the wiki markup between the words or notations. This allows the wiki format to still work even though there still is white space as it is being eliminated.
fields.summary: Wiki editor formatting does not work with white spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61060].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Running the JIRA Linux .bin installer the first time creates the "jira" user.

Subsequent installs using the .bin installer then creates the user again with an integer increment appended to the end of the user name. Ie: installing again will create jira1, jira2, jira3, etc... users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a prompt during the installation process asking the admin if the user should be created or not.
 
h3. Workaround 

Perform the steps described on [Change the User that Executes JIRA in Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Change+the+User+that+Executes+JIRA+in+Linux] and remove the user created by the JIRA installation process by using *userdel -r USER*
fields.summary: Allow admins to choose if a new user should be created or not when using the JIRA Linux .bin installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61059].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, any configuration done by an admin on project permission side can still be changed by a project admin. This deemed useless as certain permission need to be given to the project admin themselves

h3. Suggested Solution
Even though by default, a *project-level* administrator is configured to have delete ticket permission and other related project permission, if a system level admin have revoked him from these permission, he won't be allowed to re-add this permission again on his own
fields.summary: As a system admin, i do not want my configuration to be changed by a project admin

Hi everyone, 

I would like to propose implementing a new API resource for retrieving version release notes information.

Basically, all the data which is available on "https://jira.XXXX.com/jira/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=XXXX&version=XXXX" page should be available in this resource (see attachment)

The main idea behind is to allow 3rd party services to fetch this info on a per-version basis for a particular project.

"http-nio-2996-exec-14" #198 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0a8ac800 nid=0x1d6 waiting on condition [0x4fa5a000]

	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x889676b8> (a com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.getUserCount(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:409)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.isRoleLimitExceeded(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:260)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager$ActiveUserCountLoader.lambda$countCoreUsers$1(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:744)

...

	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager$ActiveUserCountLoader.countApplicationUsers(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:713)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager$ActiveUserCountLoader.lambda$load$0(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:705)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager$ActiveUserCountLoader$$Lambda$518/24388341.apply(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.map(Option.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager$ActiveUserCountLoader.load(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:705)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager$ActiveUserCountLoader.load(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:701)
...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61053].
  {panel}

Could you please make sure [documentation about the difference between 'JIRA System Administrators' and 'JIRA Administrators' global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?

# According to [Configuring issue cloning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-issue-cloning-802593136.html], this feature is only for *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
#- However, if we limit the discussion to *the cloned issue summary field prefix* feature, it can be configured by *JIRA Administrators*
# [Instrumentation|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/viewing-jira-application-instrumentation-statistics-802593019.html] page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
# [Atlassian Support Tools|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/navigating-to-the-atlassian-tools-support-page-720417607.html] page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
# [Project Import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-issues-from-jira-server-applications-802592923.html] page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
#- FYI. In [the doc about Project Import page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-issues-from-jira-server-applications-802592923.html], it uses a word *JIRA Import* but should use the word *Project Import* accurately
# [The list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27] said,
bq. Configure attachments (but they can set the size limits of attachments and enable thumbnails).
but *JIRA Administrators* also be able to configure *Enable ZIP support* in [Attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-file-attachments-802593126.html] page
# *Plugin Data Storage* page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?

Additionally, our customer must be happier if the documents about each feature also mention clearly which global permission is required to do them.

Regards,
fields.summary: Documentation about the difference between 'JIRA System Administrators' and 'JIRA Administrators' global permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61048].
  {panel}

I understand that JRA-38795 has rejected automatically updating filters when a custom field is renamed.

However if the query is stored as a string it would be possible to search these strings for any that contain the name of the custom field. 

This data could then be displayed to the administrator on the 'confirmation screen'.

Displaying the ID/name of the filters and the name of the owner would give the administrator a chance to pro-actively notify the owners of the filters that they will need to update their filters.
fields.summary: As a jira admin asked to rename a custom field, I want to know which filters contain the custom field, so I know which ones to update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61036].
  {panel}

Create a permission API endpoint for dashboards like filters.

This is dependent on having a model where a user other than the owner can edit the dashboard.

This can be a security concern that an administrator can't autocorrect a dashboard when it accidentally gets shared with the Global share permission (Everyone). 

The corrective action through the API I would envision is:
GET /rest/api/2/dashboard/:id/permission
DELETE /rest/api/2/dashboard/:id/permission/:permission_id where type==Global
POST /rest/api/2/dashboard/:id/permission
{ "type": "group", "groupname": "administrators" }

Right now to get a list of these publicly shared dashboard we can run a curl on  https://site.atlassian.net/secure/ConfigurePortalPages!default.jspa?view=popular.  While this doesn't necessarily contain sensitive information, it may include names that could indicate a non-public project codename.
fields.summary: Jira Dashboard Permissions API

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61020].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
{{<first-use-flow>}} defines a condition, but it's not observed when evaluating which first use flow needs to run.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Add a condition to the {{<first-use-flow>}} module descriptor. Make sure it evaluates to false
* Create a new user for which the {{<first-use-flow>}} condition will apply
* Login with the newly created user

h3. Expected Results
The first use flow should not be selected, since there's a condition that evaluates to false.

h3. Actual Results
The condition is not observed and the first use flow is selected anyway.

h3. Notes
The associated module descriptor, {{FirstUseFlowModuleDescriptor}}, contains a condition which is parsed from the associated XML. The code where the {{FirstUseFlowModuleDescriptor}} is used, however, never actually checks the condition when evaluating which onboarding flow has to be displayed after the user logs in for the first time.

In a nutshell, {{OnboardingServiceImpl}} needs to check the condition associated with the {{<first-use-flow>}}. This needs to happen both when the first use flow is displayed for the first time ({{OnboardingServiceImpl#startHighestWeightFlow()}}, and when the user resumes a first use flow that was previously interrupted ({{OnboardingServiceImpl#getFirstUseFlowModuleDescriptorByKey()}}).
fields.summary: FirstUseFlowModuleDescriptor condition not working

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Admin, I would like to check if a user has the Browse Project permission of a particular project which: 
* I do not have the Browse Project permission hence I am unable to input the issue(s) into the Permission Helper
* I have the Administer Project permission for. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the JIRA Admin to check for Browse projects permission for users without inputting the issue if the Admin has the administer project permission.
 
h3. Workaround 
Either the permission of "Browse projects" is granted to the JIRA admin or ensure that a user that has both the "Administer Project" and "Browse Projects" permission for that project uses the permission helper on behalf of the JIRA admin.
fields.summary: Checking for User's Browse Projects permission in permission helper without inputting issue.

h3. *Feature Summary*

When a user has an existing JIRA database that is on a secure site(SSL), there is no way to configure JIRA configurator tool to this database as the tool does not have any means of specify what protocol (HTTP vs HTTPS) to use.

h3. *Expected Behavior*

User can specify that the database hostname is on a secure site. So as to allow the configurator tool connect correctly to the database.

h3. *Actual Behavior*

There is currently no way to specify this in the existing configurator tool

h3. *Workaround*

User would need to manually modify their dbconfig file found in JIRA home, specifying the database URL in here.

Below text is still in Restricted functions in JIRA Cloud applications:
----
*Restricted function:* Change number of workflow transition buttons 
*Configurable on Request:* Yes
*Notes:* Create a support request with the number of transition buttons you want, and a 15-minute maintenance window (with 24 hours of notice) and Atlassian Support will configure it for you. (We'll be working from Advanced workflow configuration).
----

Support is not allowed to change jira-config.properties file anymore, therefore it won't be possible to configure the number of workflow buttons to display in Cloud until JRA-24522 will be implemented (if it will be implemented).

For details please see:

h3. Suggestion
Make JIRA more secure to be able connect to Gmail without additional configuration

fields.summary: Make JIRA more secure to work with Gmail when configuring Outgoing SMTP server

h3. Problem Definition
When we reach step 2 (Choose Operation) for bulk changing the issues, the colors of the options seem to be quite confusing. The available operations are shown in grey and the not-available operations are shown in black. This could make us thought of the available options are being greyed out.
!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
*Available operations* are shown in *Black* while *not-available operations* are shown in *Grey*.
fields.summary: Improvement of Color for Bulk Change (Choose Operation)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a filter in JIRA is created, the column order is supposed to be configurable by the creator of the filter. Per the documentation, if the column order of the filter is changed when the filter is selected from 'Manage Filters', the change in column selection and order should be consistent for all users. This is currently not the case. The only way to preserve column configuration is to create a filter, change the column configuration, Save As, and create a second filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a basic issue search
# Re-order the columns to the desired configuration
# Save the filter as a new filter called "Filter 1".
# Share that filter with everyone, then revisit the filter with your user. You will see that the column order persists.
# Log in as another user and view that filter. The column layout is system default and not the expected configuration.
# As the filter creator, Save As without making any changes, and create "Filter 2".
# Logging in as another user, you will see that the column order is now as it was configured by the creator of the filter.

h3. Expected Results
The column order and configuration of the filter should persist for all users and look as it did for the creator when initially saved.

h3. Actual Results
The creator has to save an additional filter for the column order and configuration to actually change for all users.
fields.summary: Filter Column Order is not initially saved
As an Admin, I want to be notified when an outage happens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60969].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The autocomplete/suggest logic used when searching for users (@mention autocompletes, user pickers, etc..) only works when the exact string searched is part of the result.

For example:
Target user to be searched for is named "Testing Username".

Searching for a phrase like "Test User" wouldn't work, because this exact phrase is not contained within the target string "Testing Username".


h3. Suggested Solution

Users would like to expand the search functionality to utilize +*spaces*+ as a separator for the search string, and search multiple values/tokens against the target name.

For example:
Target user to be searched for is named "Testing Username".

Searching for "Test User" results in two phrases to search for, "Test", and "User", both of which would result in match if used in current logic.
fields.summary: Allow for partial username searches separated by spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60957].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Due to the way third-party JQL plugins can be written, {{SearchRequest.getQueryContext}} can result in executing JQL queries. This can lead to client-side timeouts, such as the JIRA Software Manage Boards page timing out, as context lookups on JQL queries result in the JQL query being executed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Modify the code as such that it does not execute third-party queries, causing timeouts and performance problems in JIRA.
 
h3. Workaround 

Disable the affected third-party plugin or work with the plugin developers to modify the way it's designed.
fields.summary: As a user of JIRA I do not want JQL context lookups to execute third-party JQL queries, timing out web requests
Filter Column Order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60953].
  {panel}

h3. *Current situation*
Using labels in Confluence is genius. Confluence converts all upper-case letters to lower-case letters. In JIRA, one can add labels as he or she wants to.
The result is, that there is a confusion about what the correct label looks like.
E.g.: "Maintenance-Issue" or "maintenance-issue".

h3. *Suggestion*
Adding labels, having at least the same behavior for JIRA as for Confluence (and all other Atlassian products) would be great. As I think the way Confluence is handling labels is the best, I suggest to implement the Confluence approach for all Atlassian products.

{panel:title=Even better...}
In JIRA, one is able to provide a regular expression for checking project keys. This would also be great for verifying labels.
I always recommend my clients to use lower case letters only. Furthermore, I recommend to use no special characters like underscores or german umlauts expect hyphens.
Example: "hello_world" vs. "hello-world", "option_number-one" vs. "option-number-one"
By using hyphens only, it is ensured that your labels are homogeneous and the hyphen is easy to type on a keyboard because you don't need a key combination.
Using a regular expression like [a-z][\-a-z]*[a-z] ensures the correct usage of labels. :)
{panel}
fields.summary: Confluence-like labelling in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60945].
  {panel}

h3. *Issue Summary*

When a user performs a search and the result includes a lot of issue types, the user is presented with the icons for these issue types instead of the name of the issue type.

In essence, making it difficult to easily discern which issue type each issue is if they have used same images as icons.

h3. *Feature*

Can an option be added that lets the JIRA admin toggle between showing the issue type name or it's icon for their instance.

h3. *Existing Behavior*

JIRA would only show the feature name if no icon is associated with it and there's no way to toggle between the two.

h3. *Known KB that Achieves feature partly*:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Display+the+Issue+Type+Name+in+Issue+Navigator+Column+Beside+the+Image+Icon?focusedCommentId=777017168#comment-777017168
fields.summary: Show Issue Type Name instead of Icon in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60926].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Request*

As a JIRA user, it would be convenient to modify attachments added to issues directly from inside the JIRA UI rather than having to download the file, edit the file and re-upload.

Such a feature would save us time and would reduce cases of having duplicate named attachments.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a JIRA issue.
# Add attachments to the issue.
# Open the issue and attempt to edit the attachment.

*Expected Result*
User can expand the attachment section and modify it from directly within JIRA

*Actual Result*
The attachment is downloaded and user has to perform the change off JIRA and when the changes have been made, re-upload the attachment back to the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Ability to Modify attachment within JIRA

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

When sharing a search result an notification is sent containing the user and his email address in *Email from*.

*Suggested Solution*

Improve the feature to allow the customer to share an result anonymously where the notification sent will only contains the instance default email address.

Documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Sharing+a+Search+Result
fields.summary: Improve the share function to allow anonymous sharing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60920].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The Project Settings link does not appear in the main project view for Project Administrators (users with the Administrators role)

h3. Environment
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project or edit an existing one
# Add a user that is not a Global Administrator (administrator, site-admin) to the Administrators role or to a group that is part of the Administrators role
# Goto the project in JIRA

h3. Expected Results

The Project Settings link should be visible

!correctmenu.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The Project Settings link is not seen

!mainmenu.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes

The only account's that can see the link are users that belong to a [Global Administrator | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Managing+global+permissions] Group


h3.Workaround

- Users can still click on the Gear icon in the upper right hand corner and select Projects for a list of projects they have administrative rights to
- Users can type GG and then type Projects for the projects page

!sidemenu.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project Settings link missing from main project view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-filter-id-put] is wrongly stating that: "Shared filters can be updated by the Jira administrator."

* However, as a Jira administrator if I'm not the owner of the filter I will receive the following error: 

{code} {"errorMessages":["You may only create, modify or delete filters that you own."],"errors":{}} {code}

* Additionally, I cannot change the owner through REST API. 
* The REST API endpoint *[Update filter|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-filter-id-put]* provides the body parameter *owner* but this cannot be used, currently, to change the owner.

{code:java}
PUT /rest/api/3/filter/{id}
{code}


h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide the functionality to change the owner through REST API. 
* Or provide the functionality to update *sharePermissions* value without verifying ownership of the filter. 
* Or, fix the documentation. 

h3. Why this is important
* Currently, as a Jira administrator, I cannot update the filter configuration (for example *sharePermissions* value) if I'm not the owner of the filter.
* If the functionality is provided, the Jira administrator will be able to bulk update *sharePermissions* value if he notice that filters are shared with *anyone* or with any logged in user. 
* Since a Jira administrator can do the change through the UI, it would be useful to have this functionality through REST.
* The endpoint *[Update filter|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-filter-id-put]* will be richer, more useful and more efficient. 

 
h3. Workaround 
* Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I cannot change the filter sharePermissions via REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60894].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a customer has a large number of screens created in the Screens page https://<sitename>/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa the page doesn't load, it times out showing a message of Page unavailable. The results are the same should you access it through the navigation menu or just pasting the link in the browser.

h3. Suggested Solution
If we could add pagination, we could limit the number of screens to be displayed so it wouldn't time out.  

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Add pagination for "Screens" page
better icon for video attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60892].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when editing permission schemes you can select grant permission but have to type in the starting letters for each permission to grant/delete them. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to have a checkbox list for both groups/users/roles and on the other side granted permissions and run down the checkbox list. Also having a select option for the permission end of things would be great. The current method is clunky.
fields.summary: Checkbox option when editing permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60889].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Creating projects causes multiple schemes to be created.

h3. Suggested Solution

 Though there is an option to [use an existing project configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Creating+new+project+always+creates+a+new+issue+type+scheme]. We should allow for a project template on project creation that can be applied to multiple projects with a check box option. 
 
h3. Workaround 
[Creating a new project always creates a issue type schme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Creating+new+project+always+creates+a+new+issue+type+scheme]
fields.summary: Project templates for all associated schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60888].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there isn't a way to pre-populate a custom field with a project lead.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable a post function capability that allows you to populate a custom user picker field with the Project lead. See: https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JUP/User+Picker+From+Project+Role+-+Issue+Alternative+Assignee for reference. 
 
h3. Workaround 
One option is using the [JIRA MISC Workflow extensions|https://innovalog.atlassian.net/browse/JMWE-266?focusedCommentId=73172&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-73172] "Set Field Value to Constant or Groovy Expression" feature.
fields.summary: Option to populate custom field with project lead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60887].
  {panel}

h5. Description
Since JIRA 7 the pie-chart has been redesigned to a flatter and more modern interface. On certain scenarios, however, users might not feel comfortable due to the layout changes, as the new pie-charts now have the labels right below the graph instead of the old-style labels, placed over the graph.

h5. Suggested Solution
Allow users to select between old and new theme for pie-chart gadget.
fields.summary: Allow old-style pie chart to be selected by JIRA users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60883].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issue navigator doesn't list out all options for fields anymore. This recently affecting *Epic Link* field. Without knowing the wordings for the epic links, it is very difficult to get all links ticked to generate result/report in issue navigator.

Now the auto-complete will give users "Continue typing to refine further".

h3. Previously
Users were able to scroll down the options after typing a few characters for refined search.
fields.summary: Issue navigator doesn't list out all options for fields
